SafeNet Inc. Luna JSP API Specification

This is the API specification for version 6.0.0 of the Luna Java Security Provider.

See:
          Description

Packages
com.safenetinc.luna Provides a proprietary interface to the Luna HSM.
com.safenetinc.luna.ec Contains some Luna-specific classes related to Elliptic Curve Cryptography.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider Provides an implementation of a Java Security Provider that works with Luna HSMs.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.cipher Contains classes that implement various cryptographic ciphers.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.digest Contains classes that implement various message digest algorithms.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.key Contains classes that encapsulate public, private and secret key data that is stored on the Luna HSM.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.keyagree Provides a propietary interface to the Luna HSM.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.keyderive Provides a propietary interface to the Luna HSM.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.keyfactory Contains classes that implement key factories that translate and create Luna keys.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.keygen Contains classes that implement key generators to create new Luna secret keys and public/private key pairs.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.mac Contains classes that provide hashed message authentication code (HMAC) functionality.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.param Contains classes that provide various algorithm parameters for the Luna JCE implementation.
com.safenetinc.luna.provider.signature Contains classes that provide message signing and verification using keys on the Luna HSM.

 

This is the API specification for version 6.0.0 of the Luna Java Security Provider. There are two main ways to use this provider:

  • JCE interface: This is an implementation of the Java Security Provider specification that uses the Luna HSM for cryptographic operations and key storage. It is meant to be used as a drop-in replacement for the standard SUN provider, with certain limitations due to the nature of the HSM (ex. methods that involve exporting private key data directly are unsupported).
  • Proprietary interface: This makes use of the classes in the com.safenetinc.luna package. It allows for a more direct interface to the HSM, using objects that wrap a PKCS11-like API. Users that choose to use this interface should be have a good understand of the workings of the Luna HSM in addition to basic cryptographic knowledge.
